comments: I am unable to synchronize the org.eclipse.pde* projects with the /cvsroot/eclipse repository.

You'd think a committer would know to write a better bug report  ;-)  What error are you getting?  Using pserver or extssh? What version of Eclipse are you using, or are you using command-line cvs?

At first glance, I see nothing wrong with the org.eclipse.pde* directories.

>You'd think a committer would know to write a better bug report  ;-)
In my defense, take a look at the time the bug report was open.  My eloquence was not at its peak at the time ;)

It was a consistent connection timeout issue.  I would do a Team > Synchronize on my project from within an eclipse workspace, and the operation would hang mid-way.  I was using extssh.

Being the trooper that I am, I kept trying.
Around 4 am or so, the problem went away.  So it could have been a transient issue...
3:13 is quite steep; I'll cut you some slack ;)

Seeing this as well today and the a couple of times the past days. Using:

:pserver:anonymous@dev.eclipse.org:/home/eclipse

java.io.IOException: Connection refused: cvs [pserver aborted]: /home/eclipse: no such repository

(In reply to comment #4)
> Seeing this as well today and the a couple of times the past days. Using:
> 
> :pserver:anonymous@dev.eclipse.org:/home/eclipse
> 

That path has been depricated.  The correct path is /cvsroot/eclipse.

-M

traces.message: Connection refused: cvs [pserver aborted]: /home/eclipse: no such repository
